dmca.title: [EV1-C1676670S] Request for Removal of Copyrighted Material
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: abuse@ev1.net [mailto:abuse@ev1.net] 
Posted At: Tuesday, November 07, 2006 2:55 AM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: [EV1-C1676670S] Request for Removal of Copyrighted Material
Subject: [EV1-C1676670S] Request for Removal of Copyrighted Material


I have pasted the contents of the following attachment below: dmca-bestfree-nov-4.doc

MICHAEL CROOK INTERNET PROPERTIES
    8417 Oswego Road, #179
    Baldwinsville, NY 13027
www.mcipdns.com      (315) 560-8886

November 04, 2006

Our Case Number: MCDM-2006-814

To Whom it May Concern:

Pursuant to Title II of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act ("DMCA"), namely, the
Online Copyright  Infringement Liability Act, you are hereby notified that certain
potential copyright infringing materials are currently hosted by you in your
capacity as an online service provider ("OSP"). This letter serves as written
notification of claimed infringement.

As required by § 512(c)(3)(A)(i-vi) of the DMCA, the following information is
provided concerning the claimed infringement:

(i) A physical or electronic signature of a person authorized to act on behalf of
the owner of an exclusive right  that is allegedly infringed.  This signature
appears below.

(ii) Identification of the copyrighted work claimed to have been infringed, or, if
multiple copyrighted works at a single online site are covered by a single
notification, a representative list of such works at that site.

(iii) Identification of the material that is claimed to be infringing or to be the
subject of infringing activity and that is to be removed or access to which is to be
disabled, and information reasonably sufficient to permit the service  provider to
locate the material. 

The website m0.best-free.com, currently assigned to IP address: 66.98.195.217
carries this URL:

http://m0.best-free.com/?p=11827

It links to a copyrighted photograph located on a server in Ireland, in a blatant
attempt to circumvent the DMCA regulations.  This is contrary to Provision 5 of your
Acceptable Use policy, which states, in part: “se of the EV1® service to transmit
any material (by e-mail, uploading, posting or otherwise) that, intentionally or
unintentionally, violates any applicable local, state, national, or international
law
